data.title: Hometown feel
data.text: This place is popular with the locals. A casual old time atmosphere with a friendly staff.  Their food is good. Their pies are great! Several celebrities have visited over the years they have been in business.

data.title: Nostalgic
data.text: This is a perfect family owned & operated gem!! (for several generations, which is rare for 2016!) The food is great with large portions and the furnishings look out-of-the-picture-book '60s with some light Aqua-blue-green booths, lots of clean huge windows, and lots of stainless edges, legs, etc. Many pictures line the walls of famous guests who've visited and at the large coffee bar, a placard on the back of two bar stools celebrate George and Barbara Bush's dated visit. This is a "must-experience" visit to the past that you'll remember!!

data.title: Comfort food
data.text: The food is good comfort food and I just love the retro style and the attitude of everyone that works there. They make you feel at home. Prices are reasonable.

data.title: Never ever again
data.text: Went there because my son who has moved away and ate there sometimes wanted to. Had not been since we walked out about 5 years before because we couldn't get served. Rude old bat waitresses. Food just so-so. Worst Chocolate milkshake ever my granddaughter ordered. Some kind of powered flavor or something. Will not be back as long as old bats are still there.

data.title: Mother-in-law favorite
data.text:
My son-in-law lives the sundaes here!  I love the retro style and feel with some great burgers and coffee. Good wait staff and fast service. 
The restrooms are up a few stairs so be prepared for a little climb. I think it adds character, but Mom skips the upstairs thing (she's 82). 
Great place to take visitors from out of town.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Breakfast is always good here. Eggs Benedict on the weekend always good. Just an old fashion diner.  Good service and average prices.

data.title: Very nice local diner / coffee shop
data.text: I have eaten here at least 30 times or more over the years. Very good diner style food. My favorite for lunch or dinner is the Cobb salad. The best and largest I have ever anywhere. Next is there pancakes, awesome, great coffee too. By far best diner in town.

data.title: Great Throwback - Diner Style
data.text:
This is a very well cared for, thoughtfully and authentically preserved dining experience-- right down to the 60s decor. This is not meant to be fine dining - it's family and casual dining. Waitresses and staff were also very attendant and friendly.

We went for breakfast. It was just right.... Hash - great. Pancakes - great - and sizeable. Cheese Omelet  - pretty good, not spectacular.

A great place to put your feet up, let someone else do the breakfast cooking, and revel in Americana.

data.title: Americana diner
data.text: Good fresh diner food - nothing fancy just good and wholesome.  And a plaque where President Bush 1 sat.

data.title: Comfort
data.text:
Latif's has been a fixture in Turlock, it seems like forever. If you like homemade pie then try Latif's, it has some of the best pies to find anywhere. The atmosphere reminds you of the 1970. Look on the wall and you will see many pictures of famous people including President George Bush, who stopped by on a campaign swing thru California for a piece of homemade pie.
The Stevens Family has kept the tradition of good, fresh food at reasonable prices just like the original owner Charlie Latif did.
When I want a good meal, reasonable priced and with great staff, I head to Latif's

data.title: Still a great place
data.text: Been coming here since I was a kid and it is still the same.  Great breakfast.  Good lunch and the best pie around.  We bring the kids here as often as we are in town and during the summer we never leave town without a peach pie. The staff are uniformly pleasant and always remember what you like. They are very good when we have little ones with us.

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: Long time Turlock eatery.  Food and service are very good. Staff is very friendly and helpful. It's a typical small town restaurant where the locals gather to solve the problems of the world. However if you are into ambiance, this is not the place for you, just a plain old restaurant.

data.title: Comfortable drop in as you are place to meet friends
data.text: No surprises. Dependable down home atmosphere. Friendly staff and usually quick to serve. A piece of their delicious homemade pie is a must to top off your meal.

data.title: Very Retro
data.text:
Latif's has the best pies you will ever eat. Not kidding.
The restaurant has been here a long time and is a favorite of the local people.  Old school menu, such as roast beef dinner, club sandwich, homemade vegetable soup.  They even have liver and onions on the menu which my 80 year-old father loves.

data.title: Nostalgia
data.text: Come here for the history on the walls and pie .Food is average. Waitresses are nice. It is fun for breakfast.

data.title: Delicious Grandmas cooking at best!! Homemade comfort food!
data.text: We stumbled upon this place today and it did not disappoint!! I had the Philly Cheese sandwich and my husband had the Fried Chicken! It was delicious! Tender meat full of flavor! The breakfast plates looked yummy too! We topped our meal off with a piece of Lemon Meringue pie which was over the top wonderful and took a piece of Boysenberry pie to go! They had several homemade pies to choose from. We can tell they prepare their food with love and the staff are super friendly! We can't wait to go back!

data.title: Great historical Place!
data.text: Came here with a group of 10 and loved the old diner feel.  The food was great.  Our waitress was very accommodating.  Just a fun place!  Lots of famous people have visited here, too!  Will come back again.

data.title: Consistent comfort food
data.text: The historical place in Turlock to go for pies and family diner food. And you can sit in the chair where George Bush Sr had lunch if you're so inclined...

data.title: Nice size meeting rooms
data.text: The service is always good and they have several places for meetings. I've been to several breakfast Buffett meetings and a pie meeting once as well. Love the nostalgia.

data.title: Comfort food, warm service
data.text: I have been here several times, for both meetings and breakfast and lunch. Service always good. Owners are the best. Food is always consistent, good and hot. Once in awhile they have some homemade jam for breakfast if you are lucky and they have any left. Not a fancy place...just a nice. warm hometown restaurant. I have never been disappointed here
